subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] New Guy
msgSnippet: Hi, I would not worry about connections. The more you connect them the more problems you have in reading them. I think it is better to print them for
messageBody:
Hi,
I would not worry about connections. The more you connect them the more problems you have in reading them. I think it is better to "print" them for clarity. Shavian is easier to read from my own perspective. Quickscript is probably a bit faster. I tend to use Quickscript as a secret code more than anything else. I don't see it as a shorthand since alphabet shorthands are easier to learn and easier to read. Hope that answers your questions. Personally, I like the Shavian letters altho the difference between them is only 8 letter changes.
Sid

> and I was wondering how exactly the letters of Quickscript join...
> how one goes about writing it. I know that's probably a stupid
> question, and you've probably already covered this territory before,
> but I would greatly appreciate it if anyone could give me some links
> on learning it.
>
> tribal misfit
